# defaultItemIdentifiers

**Instance Property**

A required list of identifiers for items that you want to appear in the Touch Bar after instantiating it.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var defaultItemIdentifiers: [NSTouchBarItem.Identifier] { get set }
```

## Discussion

Always specify this property for an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTouchBar] object, even if you elect to make the bar noncustomizable. The system:

- Shows this list’s items by default when the system displays the bar.
- Includes a preconfigured bar, containing these items, in the associated customization UI (when you have assigned the bar a [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTouchBar/customizationIdentifier-swift.property] property value); the user can drag the default bar into the Touch Bar, should they want to return to the default configuration.

The system archives this property.

## Related Documentation

- **customizationIdentifier**: A globally unique string that makes the Touch Bar eligible for user customization.
- **customizationRequiredItemIdentifiers**: An optional list of identifiers for items you want to always appear in the Touch Bar and which the user can’t remove during customization.
- **customizationAllowedItemIdentifiers**: A list of identifiers for items to show in the Touch Bar’s customization UI.
- **itemIdentifiers**: The list of identifiers for the current items in the Touch Bar.

## Providing bar items

- **delegate**: The delegate that provides items to the Touch Bar.
- **templateItems**: The primary source of items that the Touch Bar uses to fill its private items array, unless you provide items using a delegate.
- **principalItemIdentifier**: The identifier of an item you want the system to center in the Touch Bar.
- **escapeKeyReplacementItemIdentifier**: The identifier of an item that replaces the system-provided button in the Touch Bar.
